page.title: 15LANDSCAPE. OUT AND ABOUT(2)
page.content: We are now in Bourne Bottom, a very contraversial area at the moment. This is the valley through which the Bourne Stream runs. Plans to run a ring road through this area are being challenged by local residents and conservation groups. This is understandable as it is a beautiful piece of countryside right in the middle of a highly populated area. We saw a group of magpies nesting close to the Stream. Whilst in the Stream minnows darted to and fro. We wondered what else might be lurking in the undergrowth. Walking up the other side of the valley we come to a large, mainly council estate, known as Rossmore. As we walked on we were reminded of a rabbit warren because there were so many little cul-de-sacs. We walked for almost an hour without seeing a shop.
